```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
```


Load the package
```{r}
library(FACavian)
```


The defaults for runFAC_multi() are set to reproduce Figure 28.3 in the original Runge and Marra paper.  This is a 3D surface showing...

```{r}
F28_3 <- runFAC_multi()
```

Look at the dataframe
```{r}
head(F28_3)
```

Plot the 3D surface.
```{r}
par(mfrow = c(1,1))
plot_Fig28_3(F28_3)
```
